channel.title: Alchemist Change (Suggestion)
channel.description:
>**Alchemist Neutral Special** Coagulate (Passive) - Immune to bleeding. Stone Skin(Day) - Make yourself immune to attacks - 3 Uses. Poison Tar(Day) - Poison someone killing them at night, you cannot heal them but others can - 2 Uses. Crimson Potion(Night) - Heal Someone curing them of bleeding and saving them from attacks - Infinite Uses. Narcotic Potion(Night) - Make someone appear Suspicious under investigation - Infinite Uses.
Makes alchemist have primary abilities that are more evil but can save lifes and be good it lets players play alchemist in a more deceptive way, lets bd be less accepting of D1 alchs but the alchs could offer help to bd as they still have heal and a option to kill "evil" players.
Alchemist framing players is more of a self gain because it helps alch instead of bd while healing helps bd and doesn't help alchemist, so it gives alchs a choice on which side they want to help.
While Bombing is generally more evil sided it can be used to bomb evils and is only limited (For a good reason).

item.title: Alchemist Change (Suggestion)
item.dc:creator: Magnus
item.description:
Once there was this situation:
I was BD. King was evil. There was one alch. There was a Reaper. The alch wanted Reaper to win, but didn’t know who they were. I whispered the alch, claiming I was the Reaper, meanwhile saying publicly the Reaper was Reaper. Together we voted the king, and alch killed the Reaper.

Read full topic

item.title: Alchemist Change (Suggestion)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
JakeTheWolfie:

Merc doesn’t have to be a viable claim for Merc.

True for the same reasons. Next

JakeTheWolfie:

Knight doesn’t have to be a viable claim for Knight

Technically true but practically false. But not for the reason you would think.

Prince is actually somewhat close to not being a viable prince claim, since losing the Prince is so problematic that outing is too dangerous if it can possibly be avoided.

Now the real reason why Knight needs to be a viable Knight claim is because short of being so powerful when hidden as to singlehandedly win the game it’s just better to claim your real class when pressured as BD. Why can’t we make a BD claim unviable for themselves like we can for neuts?

Not because making a BD who’s best option is to fake claim is problematic, there are plenty of examples of that such as the Hunter in One night ultimate werewolf and the Seer in resistance. But instead because in throne of lies, making it so that a Knight claim is unviable for knight would mean that the Knight itself is negative utility, which is a balance and game health issue.

For neutrals, helping the BD isn’t part of their wincon so being anti-BD isn’t an issue like it is for the BD. Same obviously applies to scum.

Read full topic

item.title: Alchemist Change (Suggestion)
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Soulshade55r:

I’ve done it a couple of times I claimed mystic as sheriff because there where 3 dead sheriffs and one was a poss jump (of course) it made it so prince didn’t wasteall his executes.

I remember jailing a court wizard N1, trusted him, claimed my actual name and told him to claim prince tomorrow and to whisper me the claims. I told him then to swap himself with me in a row. Because, if I was to be attacked I would have zero protectives on me. The death would go to the court wizard, while all attacks to him will go to me with protectives.

Read full topic

item.description:
Soulshade55r:

woah people not claiming d1 as neutral and fake claiming instead it’s almost like that’s a good strategy sometimes.

want to know how bad of a claim knight is

I sometimes didn’t claim knight as knight and claimed a different non confirmable class
For example, let’s say everyone claimed and I claimed butler as a knight. Now out of all the claims, there’s no protective claims since I switched my claim. evils will try attacking the prince or something since it’s “safe” and bam
